intro: Arrabidaea japurensis, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces legume pods that contain its seeds. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
